messages.message: sarah what artifacts do you get injected to you other then history

Sarah: For Sprint Reviews, I get injected with the project vision, current backlog (stories, statuses, notes), and the latest sprint execution summary (including completed stories, generated files location, and test command). This helps me demo accurately and update the backlog based on your feedback. No other artifacts—keeps things focused on the review.

Now, back to the sprint: Ready to demo US-006 (Leave Calendar)? Run the test command if you haven't, and let me know your thoughts after testing.
can you tell from the backlog what items are developed in which sprint

Sarah: Yes, the backlog tracks this via the "Sprint_ID" and "Execution_Status" columns. Here's a quick breakdown of developed/completed stories by sprint (based on the current data; "In Sprint" means queued but not fully done, "Backlog" means not started):

- **SP-001** (Completed: US-006 - View Leave Calendar; US-008 - Onboarding Checklist; US-001 - Employee Directory Search; US-015 - Add Employee Profile):
  - All marked "done" after execution.

- **SP-002** (Partially completed: US-010 - Mock Login Page done; US-016 - Automated Local Setup Script "In Sprint"; NFR-001 - Local Testing: No Security Barriers "In Sprint"):
  - Focused on setup and login for local testing.

- **SP-003** (Completed: US-017 - Local SQLite Migration & App Consolidation):
  - Consolidated code for local SQLite run.

Other stories (e.g., US-002, US-003, etc.) are still in "Backlog" and unassigned to a sprint.

This is from the injected backlog—helps prioritize for reviews. For today's Sprint Review on SP-001 (US-006 & US-008), shall we demo them? Run the test command if ready.
is the vision injected

Sarah: Yes, the full project vision (problem, users, features, success criteria, constraints, etc.) is injected into my context for every Sprint Review. It ensures demos align with the overall goals, like streamlining HR for small businesses via local SQLite in Phase 1.

Ready to proceed with the SP-001 review? Let's demo US-006 if you've run the test command.
doesn't the vision have the project name I wonder why you said unidentified before

Sarah: Good catch—the vision clearly states "PROJECT: BrightHR Lite Vision," but the sprint execution summary artifact lists "Project Name: Unknown" (likely a metadata glitch from the generation process). I prioritize the vision for all reviews, so we're aligned on BrightHR Lite.

To keep us moving: For the SP-001 review, run `./test-generated-app.command` if not already, then test US-006 (Leave Calendar) at http://localhost:8001/calendar. Feedback?
hi team
Hey team, good to see you! What's on the agenda?
Hey team! What's up?
Hi team! Ready to test any changes.
Hi team! Great to see you—how can we kick things off today?
what project is this for

Mike: This sprint planning is for the **BrightHR Lite** project—our streamlined HR platform for small businesses, focusing on employee directory, leave management, document storage, and more, all built with a local Mac-friendly setup (Flask, HTML/Tailwind, SQLite for now, with tests).

What do you want to accomplish in this sprint? For example, are we building on the recent local setup (US-017 done, with mock login and employee search/add working)? Or tackling a specific feature like leave requests? Let me know your priorities so I can analyze the backlog and propose a logical set of 2-5 user stories.
hello so what project is this for

Hello! This sprint planning session is for the **BrightHR Lite** project—a lightweight HR platform for small businesses (10-50 employees) to manage employee directories, leave requests, documents, and more. It's built with a focus on simplicity, local development (Flask + SQLite for now), and self-service features to cut down on spreadsheet chaos.

What are you hoping to accomplish in this sprint? For example, do you want to tackle a specific feature like leave management, build on the existing employee directory, or focus on something else from the backlog? Once I know, I can propose a logical set of user stories.
how are we today

Mike: Hey, we're doing great today—pumped to keep building out BrightHR Lite! The local setup with SQLite is solid now from the last sprint (US-017 wrapped up nicely), so we can focus on features without those cloud hiccups. How about you? What do you want to tackle in this sprint? Are we prioritizing leave management next, or something else from the MVP like document uploads? Let's nail down your goals so I can propose some stories.
how is the backlog how many items

The current backlog for BrightHR Lite contains 28 total items across User Stories (US), Wireframes (WF), Non-Functional Requirements (NFR), and Styles (STYLE). Of these, 16 are in "Backlog" status (ready for refinement), 6 are "In Sprint" (active), and 6 are "Done" (completed). Key areas include employee management (US-001 to US-017), UI wireframes (WF-001 to WF-015), and supporting NFRs like local testing (NFR-001).
end meeting
Sarah: 📝 Meeting ended: Requirements Meeting: BrightHR Lite
how many vision statements do we have

We currently have one approved vision document: the BrightHR Lite Vision (from our previous session). You can view it anytime by clicking the Vision button in the interface.

If you'd like to refine that one, start a new vision meeting for a different project, or dive into answering those 7 questions to build or update it, just let me know how I can help! What's next on your mind?
end meeting
📝 Meeting ended: Vision Meeting: BrightHR Lite
how many items do we have

Sarah: We currently have 28 items in the backlog for BrightHR Lite, including User Stories (US), Wireframes (WF), Non-Functional Requirements (NFR), and Styles (STYLE). This covers MVP must-haves like employee directory and leave management, along with nice-to-haves and constraints.

You can view the full backlog anytime by clicking the Backlog button. What would you like to do next—add a new item, update priorities, or something else?
end meeting
📝 Meeting ended: Requirements Meeting: BrightHR Lite Vision
hi

Sarah: Hi! Great to see you back in the Requirements Meeting for BrightHR Lite.

What would you like to tackle today—reviewing a specific item (e.g., US-001), adding new stories, updating priorities, or something else?

To get us started, could you share your thoughts on the project name, or maybe jump to the problem it solves? Or if you'd like, we can pick up from where we left off last time. What's on your mind first?
